type.name: section
type.title: Establishment and constitution of the National Parks Commission.
type.context: NATIONAL PARKS COMMISSION ACT under Establishment and constitution of the National Parks Commission. 3.  (1) There is hereby established a body to be LAWS OF GUYANA                                                                                                                                                                                  National Parks Commission Cap. 20:06 5  L.R.O. 1/2012 of the National Parks Commission.                                            Policy directions. known as the National Parks Commission which shall be a body corporate.  (2) The Commission shall consist of not less than four nor more than eleven members appointed by the Minister.  (3) Any member other than the Chairman or Deputy Chairman may at any time resign his office as such by instrument in writing addressed to the Chairman who shall cause the same to be forwarded to the Minister and upon the date of the receipt by the Chairman of the instrument such member shall cease to be a member.  (4) The Chairman or Deputy Chairman may at any time resign his office as such by instrument in writing addressed to the Minister and such resignation shall take effect upon the date of the receipt of such instrument by the Minister.  (5) If the Chairman or Deputy Chairman ceases to be a member, he shall also cease to be Chairman or Deputy Chairman as the case may be.  (6) Four members of the Commission shall form a quorum.  (7) There shall be paid to the Chairman and other members of the Commission such remuneration, if any (whether by way of salaries or travelling or other allowances), as the Minister may determine.  (8) The appointment, removal from office, or cessation of the tenure of office, of the Chairman or any other member shall be notified in the Gazette.

type.name: section
type.title: Duties and functions of the Commission.
type.context: NATIONAL PARKS COMMISSION ACT under Duties and functions of the Commission. 5. It shall be the function of the Commission to  (a)  maintain and regulate the use of any designated park so as  to  leave  it  unimpaired  for  the  enjoyment  of  future generations;  (b)  make  recommendations  to  the  National  Trust  to achieve the conservation of the natural beauty of any area of land in Guyana and to carry out such acts as the National Trust directs for the purpose of attaining the objectives of those recommendations;  (c)  collaborate  with  local  government  authorities  in developing any area of land subject to the control of any such authority for the purpose of affording to members of the public opportunity for open air recreations;  (d)  provide to local government authorities maintenance services in respect of parks on such terms and conditions as the Commission sees fit;  (e)  give general advice to the Minister or any statutory body  in  relation  to  the  provision  or  improvement  of opportunities  for  the  enjoyment  of  the  countryside  by members of the public.

type.name: section
type.title: Protection of members of the Commission.
type.context: NATIONAL PARKS COMMISSION ACT under Protection of members of the Commission. 8. (1) No action, suit, prosecution or other proceedings shall be brought or instituted personally against any member in respect of any act done bona fide in pursuance of the execution or intended execution of this Act.  (2) Where any member is exempt from liability by reason only of the provisions of subsection (1), the Commission shall be liable to the extent  that  it would be if such member were an officer or other employee, or agent, of the Commission.

type.name: section
type.title: Assets and resources of the Commission.
type.context: NATIONAL PARKS COMMISSION ACT under Assets and resources of the Commission. 11.  (1) The assets and resources of the Commission shall consist of  (a)  any funds or property standing at the commencement of this Act to the credit, or in the name, of that body referred to as the National Parks Commission in the Estimates of of expenditures approved by the National Assembly for the financial year ending 31st December, 1977;  (b)  such other sums as may be provided by Parliament; and  (c)  all other sums or property which may in any manner become payable to or vested in the Commission for the general purposes of the Commission or in respect of any matter incidental thereto.  (2) The expenses of the Commission (including any remuneration of the members, employees and agents thereof) shall be paid out of the assets and resources of the Commission. type.name: section
type.title: Accounts and report to the Minister.
type.context: NATIONAL PARKS COMMISSION ACT under Accounts and report to the Minister. 12.  (1) The accounts of the Commission shall be audited annually by the Director of Audit and the members, officers and employees of the Commission shall grant to the Director of Audit access to all the books, documents, cash and securities of the Commission and shall give to him on request all such information as shall be within their knowledge in relation to the operation of the Commission.  (2) The Commission shall in each year prepare a report on its activities in the last preceding year and shall furnish such report to the Minister not later than the thirtieth day of June.

type.name: section
type.title: By-laws.
type.context: NATIONAL PARKS COMMISSION ACT under By-laws. 13. (1) The Commission may, with the approval of the Minister, make by-laws in respect of any or all designated parks for the purpose of carrying out the functions of the Commission under this Act, and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, such by-laws may  (a)  make provision for the imposition and collection of fees under which any person may enter, travel through, or in any way make use of such parks and any of the facilities therein;   (b)  prohibit or regulate the use of the park or any part thereof either generally or in any manner specified in the by-laws, by traffic of any description so specified;  (c)  contain provisions prohibiting the depositing of rubbish and the leaving of litter;  (d)  prohibit or restrict the killing, taking, molesting or disturbance  of  living  LAWS OF GUYANA                                                                                                                                                                                  National Parks Commission Cap. 20:06 11  L.R.O. 1/2012                                                 creatures  of  any  description  in  a designated park, the taking, destruction or disturbance of eggs of  any  such creature, the taking of, or interference with, vegetation of any description in such park or the doing of anything therein which will interfere with the soil or damage any object in the park.  (2) By-laws made under subsection (1) may provide that the breach thereof shall be an offence punishable on summary conviction by a fine not exceeding twenty-seven thousand, five hundred dollars and to imprisonment for six months.  (3) By-laws may provide for the recovery by the Commission from any offender, in addition to any penalty imposed under subsection (2), or from the proceeds of any sale by the Commission of property taken possession of  by the Commission in breach of such by-laws, of the expenses incurred  by the Commission in consequence of such breach and the exercise by the Commission of its powers to ensure compliance with the by-laws.  (4) At least fourteen days before application for the approval of the Minister of the by-laws is made, notice of the intention to apply for approval shall be published and a copy of the proposed by-laws for which approval is intended to be sought shall be deposited in the office of the Commission and be open for public inspection without payment of fee at all reasonable hours during the period ensuing between the publication and the day of application.  (5) All by-laws submitted to the Minister for approval shall be accompanied by copies of any objection to the adoption of the by-laws which has been lodged in writing with the Chairman or if no such objection has been LAWS OF GUYANA 12 Cap. 20:06                                                                                       National Parks Commission  L.R.O. 1/2012                Exemption  from taxes.      Statutory Authorities and the  Commission.                       lodged, a certificate by the Chairman to that effect.  (6) The Minister may approve with or without amendment or reject any by-laws submitted to him.  (7) A copy of by-laws which have been approved shall be deposited at the office of the Commission and be open at all reasonable hours to public inspection without fee and another copy shall be kept displayed at a conspicuous place in the park to which the by-laws relate.
